comments.body: Here's a colored Quartz that I came up with: Mystic Quartz

Brick variants as well. Quartz should have different real life variants for different colors.

 

Purple = Amethyst

Orange = Citrine

Pink = Rose Quartz

Brown = Smoky Quartz

Green = Adventurine

Light Blue = Chalcedony

Lime = Prasiolite

Black = Onyx

Red = Carnelian

Cyan = Chrysocoolla

Light Gray = Chert

Blue = Blue Quartz

Magenta = Ametrine

Gray = Agate

Yellow = Yellow Agate

White = Regular Quartz without cream color.
Oh yeah, it would be a really cool addition! And they would naturally generate in a fisher's house in villages.
I think right clicking an armor stand with 2 sticks will add em as hands, that should be reasonable.
I guess because you would have to relight it and that would bother a lot of players seeing that you would have to use a lot of Flint and Steels to do so.
It wouldn't be, because torches will be lit by default and will remain lit (doesn't burn out) unless splashed with water.
Ok. I'm in.
Thank you so much, my post is approved by Mojang now =}

I think that ender pearls shouldn't be able to be crafted into nuggets, as they don't do anything but serve as a drop.
Also, I think endermites should drop 1-3 nuggets per kill, or 6-9 with looting three, but you didn't specify your preferred drop rate.
Other then that, I agree completely.
I don't think this should be the main drop of an endermite, but this would be an excellent common drop, especially since endermites have no drops currently.
Humble apologies for my inexperienced precision of peculiar details, it's up for mojang to decide if this even should be a thing xD
Tbh i bet many people have been complaining about endermites being a needless additional nuisance, but at least you have a way of getting *some* parts back for a new ender pearl.
Having the Loyalty enchantment on a Sword would take away the special abilities from the Trident.
That would be cool if you go watch the trailer you can see in the trailer the player throws sword at pillager so this might come to the game.
They actually said in a youtubers video that it was not going to part of Minecraft sadly. It was just for content.
Sorry but they couldn't remove the helm no matter how hard they tried. That's why it has the name "binding" in it.
This would take away the properties of the curse.

Not completely, Blast Burner. If it's multiplayer and very low tier armor, yes, you're correct. But remember, the player wearing it still can't take it off themselves. If they put it on accidentally in Single Player, they're still stuck with it. Perhaps if a failed attempt reduced the durability in a significant proportion to its full durability, giving it a chance to potentially break, would that be a bit more worth it?
The strength of a single player has the same strength as any other player in the game. That still makes it impossible to remove it unless the wearer dies.

I'm a proponent of this idea. However, I think there's something too easy about this. Perhaps another player CAN remove it, but the armor slot is taken up for x amount of days afterward. There needs to be something semi-permanent about the curse that really renders the player helpless in some regard, just not gamebreaking. But still a huge inconvenience.

Netherite

I really like this idea! I was going to suggest they put packed ice under the topsoil in a tundra biome, but I like your idea of a permafrost block much more :)

And perhaps saplings cannot grow if there is permafrost within (x) metres of the surface

I really like the idea of a permafrost too, however as we have powder snow now, we already have a cold block causing damage. Therefore I would suggest simply creating it as a own block with unique features (the permafrost dirt) or even as block state which could be "permafrost: true/false". All in all it should be a kind of dirt which is hard like stone (hardness of 1.5) and is being generated in snowy and mountain biomes instead of normal dirt.

Well i don't know about this Particular implementation of the idea, I do support A way to have creative builds use darkness without worrying about mobs spawning.

Also i umm think you put this in the wrong section
I put it here unsure, but the description talks about improving mobs which is what I try to make point of via a mob proofing system. So I wasnâ€™t entirely sure

1. Too unfair
  2. Just No
  3. just why

There is a reason why you have to be naked when sneaking up on someone. You want to kill him? You have to risk he finds you with your trousers down. Also, you can equip weapons/armor very fast when its in the 9 slots.
I think they should do this on invisibility potions with an amplifier of 1 or higher. Even if it isn't actually obtainable in survival this would be really good for minigame and mapmaking.
Another reason this should get added: with normal invisibility, the ender dragon can see you. With this, however... (you see where I'm going with this, right?)
I personally see the need for something like this but what you described just doesn't seem to give it to me. Also, Gold is heavy, it would slow you down.

Tbf I'm just giving an idea of how a tiered system would work, I don't think it should be exactly as I propose. I'm just providing a possible solution to:

1) Give the game a more integrated blacksmith aspect, which could relate to the blacksmith and Fletcher villagers and their corresponding blocks (which currently have no use)

2) give more purpose to using leather and gold. Again leather is useless as armor to the point that I don't even bother making them I just wait for iron to make armor. Gold is pretty much useless, unless you're making apples or powered rails. instead of asking for new items I simply want to give more use to the ones available.

3) Give a personal touch and more options in how you decide to make your own armor and tool sets, by the time everyone in a world has diamonds, everyone is just wearing blue armor and that's it.

My main point is that lower tier items become obsolete too fast, instead of them just being weaker version of diamonds they could add effects or different stats to your equipment specially when you add mod drops to the mix, rotten flesh could add a poison effect to weapons, wither roses a wither effect (that last as long as the flower itself, could be enhanced with emeralds or something).

As for the gold I'm aware that gold is a dense metal lol, I was just going by the fact that gold has already a higher efficiency than diamond, so I was just going from that. The items don't exactly have to follow the manner as I proposed them. I'm more interested in the tier system and customization. Considering that a big aspect of Minecraft is the "Build your own world" aspect I don't see how the items themself can't reflect that.

If you like the idea what would you change to make it more appealing to everyone?

I thought about giving a limit of enchantment for each armor type, with the Golden gear having the possibility to have many enchantment, while Netherite and Diamond would have the least. Iron, leather and chain mail would stay in between. also, Gold can't make you lighter, because gold is even heavier than iron and copper...
mojang please i want roller skates
This seems very interesting indeed.

1 arrow + 1 paper = 1 message arrow. Message arrows should have a stack size of 1, and you get a sign prompt to enter the message when you have crafted the message arrow. (There should be a way to read the message on each message arrow you craft, so you don't shoot the wrong one by accident.)

Message arrows should be launchable by bows, crossbows, and dispensers.

A launched message arrow will travel until it hits a player, mob, or solid block.

Whoever picks up a launched message arrow from a solid block gets an arrow and a blank piece of paper in their inventory (or are dropped on the ground), and the message itself is output to their chat window only.

If a player gets shot with a message arrow, they are damaged as if by a normal arrow, they get the achievement "Message For You Sir!", the arrow and paper go into their inventory (or are dropped), and the message on the message arrow is output to their chat window only.

A message arrow that hits a mob does damage to the mob as normal, and the arrow, paper, and the message itself are lost.

I completely agree because op Minecraft is not how you play. For example: if you play in a world for lets say a month you got slot of diamonds right? Well with this added it would be to easy to get lots of diamonds forever and that's what MENDING is for.
I agree strongly. Mojang, you need more black and grey blocks to help builders!
Well, I guess blackstone and basalt in 1.16 will have to do for the time being (to be honest, not complaining at all :D)

I think this idea will radically change the appearance of the game! This functionality should be for gravel, red sand, and cement.
